acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in transfers of court papers from Goochland County.
Microfilm reels were generated by Backstage Library Works through the Library of Virginia's Circuit Court Records Preservation Program.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Goochland County was named for Sir William Gooch, lieutenant governor of Virginia from 1727 to 1749. It was formed from Henrico County in 1728.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Goochland County (Va.) Fiduciary Records, 1728-1899, includes administrators' bonds, dower appraisements, estate accounts, executors' bonds, guardians' bonds, and inventories and appraisements.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Goochland County Court records can be found on microfilm at The Library of Virginia web site. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm
